Investigation started here because I don't like waiting for support team to take their sweet time, no one helped but I guess I found out a bunch of stuff myself!

Anyways, one major thing that helped was forcing my DNS to google's, the reason for it was because the ISP or server I was using had an error that basically every time something uses it, it redirects it and magical shit happens so that caused some disconnections and major lag as the League Client constantly is sending in information and sometimes it gets redirected or denied because your ISP wants to stuff you with ads or something like that.

So anyways, after I did it, magically the games that recently were dreadful with being 4-10 seconds behind became crystal clear without as much unstability.

I did a bunch of shit to isolate it to this, there were other things I did to keep on optimizing (Rackier must be looking up from Hell and smiling as someone actually took his advice now), but this might help if you have Windows:

Go to your Network and Sharing Center by right clicking your connection icon at the tray, then click on your connection, then go to the place under activities that says properties (should probably have the admin icon on it) and then go to the bottom where it says "Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP /IPv4)", right click it, click properties, click advanced, go to the DNS tab, delete anything in the first box if you see anything, then click "add" and add the following two DNS addresses of "8.8.8.8" and "8.8.4.4", those are the Google DNS addresses, then click ok ({{champion:33}}) and click on the radio button that says "Use the following DNS servers addresses" and it should say those two addresses there, then click ok twice ({{champion:33}} {{champion:33}}), and you did it!

This helped me, I hope it helped you as not everyone knows everything so hopefully it helps you guys out too, I am just glad I found out one of the problems that was causing it. Another problem is a lot trickier to get rid of is the MITM (Man-In-The-Middle) attack, but that requires me to talk to my providers personally to ask them to get me a new encryption key as mine is corrupted now.

Again, I hope it helps! East Coast pings suck enough as it is already, it sucks even more when there are things interfering with it such as greedy asshole ISPs.

Funny thing is that I did the job of the support team...granted they might have responded with similar ideas, I doubt I would have been given much if any information because the last time I sent in those diagnostics, none of them read it and told me about the issues I found out for myself. Shrugs.

Edit: If you are having trouble connecting to a game and saying you have been disconnected from the internet, follow these steps:

Go to Command Prompt as Admin
Type:
ipconfig /release (hit enter)
ipconfig /flushdns (hit enter)
ipconfig /renew (hit enter)
